name: Avoid SQL queries that no index can support
associatedValueName: Database table name accessed without using any index
description:
This metric retrieves the artifacts containing at least one SQL Query not using a table's indexes. 
An SQL Query is using table's indexes if all the following conditions are true: 

- At least one index is defined for each table participating in the from list
- Queries must reference left-most columns of the index key
output:
Associated to each Artifact with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The database table name accessed without using any index
rationale:
SQL Queries that do not use table indexes are extremely dangerous for the application's performance.
Indeed, each execution of the query will result in a full table scan which is extremely time consuming.
reference:
http://it-cisq.org/
CISQ: ASCPEM-PRF-05

Enhancing the Quality of ABAP Development
Meijs - Krouwels - Heuvelmans - Sommen
SAP Press
ISBN 1-59229-030-2
remediation: Try to use indexed columns in WHERE and HAVING clauses. If it is not possible, then create a secondary index for these columns.
